column5: anyone fish this body of water before.looking for fishing info lures,tactics as i will be visiting this lake in 2 weeks. thanks in advance.jig

It has been a number of years since I have fished Clay. When we were there, about the same time of year that you will be there, we fished a shoreline that I would say was northwest of the resort. North of Gull rock. It was a sandy shore and we anchored 20 yards from shore and pitched jigs towards shore. We let the jig drag the bottom as we brought it in and just nailed the walleyes. I think the record was 14 casts in a row catching a fish without a miss. We also fished in the evenings to the west of the resort in an area that narrows down. There used to be some jugs marking rocks and we slip bobbered there and caught plenty of walleyes. There is also a bay north of the narrows area that held alot of fish. I'm not sure if this helps, but good luck.

be sure to ck our Christmas Island as well as Cooper's narrows. (take an extra full tank of gas with you) and if adventerous (sp) do a day trip to Seguise. You will find the lodge owners very willing to help you find fish. Have a great trip
Jigmeister - How was your trip? We are heading up in two weeks?
Jigmeister, how about a report of how you did?Tx jig tyr

we fished the last week of may.the water was very high and muddy on the main lake.the weather was chilly at best.you had to get out of the main basin of the lake to have much success. the hay marsh,and one mile lake were the most consistent the water changed to the tea stained color.we caught many walleye 23&up with the biggest 26-1/2.northern fishing was slow,with a 36 inch being the biggest.either you were catching very small,or over the slot.on a scale of 1-10 the week was a 5.quality was good numbers were down..jig
